text: hello this is Bill Cunningham from New
York and the signs of spring not
happening overnight Monday it was I
think 70 degrees in the morning Thursday
it was up to 61 and last Sunday a
dramatic sign was the transformation of
the winter ice skating arena at Bryant
Park was completely dismantled and more
than 20 workers were unrolling grass
turf and by the end of the day the great
earth covered Center was now a lawn
it was fantastic I mean you talk about
home there it was as fashion changes
into the spring palette is yet to be
seen the gray white and black palette of
winter was enlivened with almost a
mirror-like silver even the Driss Van
Noten coats hand-painted huge splashy
silver flowers or the card that looked
like it was who's probably chrome
mirrored and the patterns of the circle
in black white grey are the stripes
black and white picking up the barcodes
on the West Village
everywhere there are signs hopefully the
next installment will be spring
